content: Who wrote the classic novel 'Pride and Prejudice', which tells the story of Elizabeth Bennet as she deals with issues of manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage in the society of the landed gentry of early 19th-century England?

The classic novel 'Pride and Prejudice' was written by Jane Austen. The story revolves around Elizabeth Bennet and her interactions with the society of the landed gentry in early 19th-century England, exploring themes such as manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage.
